ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write scientifically, present my own research, and write a grant proposal.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is designed pretty well. I just wish that the grant proposal was not due the same week as the oral presentations.
Need more clear feedback from course administrators on assignments

One way in which the course could improve is by having students in the course learn about how to give an effective presentation. This could be done with a seminar about presentation skills, for example.  A student could be doing great research, but if they are not able to give a presentation that effectively engages the audience, then the great work that they are doing seems not as interesting to the audience.
I would appreciate a bit more communication as to what the expectations of the course are throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this course gives you two credits for conducting research in the lab. I feel like the amount of time this class requires you to spend in the lab is the amount of time that many students are spending in the lab anyways, and this course allows you to synthesize all your research, which is an important skill.
yes, please do intensive -- no reason not to, tbh
I would recommend doing the intensive major if you are doing 20+ hours a week in lab.
